title: Buying Time
content: When facing time pressure, ask: can I buy more time? Sometimes you can slow the situation while you decide. Reducing energy, backing off, putting systems in a safer stateâ€”these create decision space. Before accepting time pressure as fixed, look for ways to extend your decision window.

mcq.question: A situation is developing rapidly. You have maybe 30 seconds before decision is forced. What should you consider first?

options.A: Make the best decision you can in 30 seconds
options.B: Is there an action that could slow this down and give you more time?

mcq.explanation: Before accepting the 30-second constraint, see if you can buy time. Can you reduce load, back off, put something in a safer state? If you can buy time, you can make a better decision.

openQuestions: What techniques exist in your operation to buy time during developing situations?
When have you successfully bought time to make a better decision?
